result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas M. Soman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE SENTENCE ORDERED ON FEBRUARY 9, 2015 IS VACATED.
Concurrent with: any sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

timeConds.notes: Concurrent with: prison sentence now serving.

records.addlTxt: from DOC
DOB corrected on the record.
to Reopen Judgment and Adjust the Sentence.
from Attorney Joy to the Judge.
Hearing at 06-24-2015 10:15 am
of 2/9/15 plea/sentencing hearing.
from DOC.  Sent to Judge for review.

Defendant plead guilty to Count 1.  Priors confirmed.  Court reviewed plea questionnaire/elements/rights with defendant.  Felony warnings given.  He understands.  Court finds plea is made and rights waived freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Finds a factual basis exists.  Court finds guilty of Count 1.  Joint sentencing recommendation made.   Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  Court orders 2 years total sentence.  9 months incarceration, and 15 months extended supervision.  Concurrent with any sentence now serving.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.  CC.  Find not eligible for ERP and SAR.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody and with Attorney Joy. Court questions defendant on waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court finds that defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing.  Waive reading of information (none filed).
Status conference at 02-09-2015 03:00 pm
